hive_text_custom.text: Hi, I’m Mari. I’m here with Ron. Ron is from Hawaii. So Ron, what is so special about Hawaii?

Well, Hawaii is my home, but to people not from Hawaii, I think Hawaii is famous for its nice weather, its warm all year ‘round, also it’s known for its beaches. The beaches are very nice. And it’s also known for its
. The people are also very nice.
So can you tell me more about the weather? It’s always sunny? It never rains?
It does rain, but often it rains and it's sunny at the same time, so we have a lot of rainbows. Hawaii is also famous for rainbows.
That’s nice. Can you tell me more about the beach?

We have beaches on all shores of the island -- all our islands. There’s many beaches to choose from. And often, some beaches have big waves, some beaches have small waves, and you can choose which beach to go to depending on whether you want to surf in big waves or you want to swim where there’s no waves.
Can you tell me maybe about the nature in Hawaii?
We have forests, so there’s lots of animals, like birds, and small animals like wallabies: we have Hawaiian wallabies and they live in the forest.
Wallabies, they’re those little mammals from Australia and they were
in Hawaii and now they’re wild in Hawaii. They’ve become their own species.
They look like little kangaroos I think.
Interesting. Any other interesting animals in Hawaii?
We have a lot of pigs, wild pigs. We like to go hunting for them and we like to eat them.
Are there any animals that live in the sea?
We have nice coral reefs, so there’s lots of beautiful fish in our coral reefs and many people like to go
to look at our reefs. We also have turtles and seals in Hawaii.
We do have whales during the months of March
February I believe. They come from Alaska and they come to Hawaii during those months and then they return to Alaska.
Wow, there are a lot of animals that live in Hawaii.

hive_text_custom.text: to scuba diving because it is cheaper.
